CIRCULAR  14  /  1998 
 
 
SUB: CARRIAGE OF  KIRPAN 
 
 
In has been brought to the notice of the Bureau Headquarters that on a number of 
occasions `Mahantas’ of different `Akharas’ travel by air carrying `Trishul’ which they refuse 
to part with.  This is contrary to the order on the subject. 
 
2. 
It is reiterated that only the carriage of `Kirpan’ by Sikh passenger on his person of 
the length not exceeding 22.86 cms. (9 inches), the blade of which should not be more than 
15.24 cms. (6 inches) is allowed on board the passenger flight within India.  Therefore, 
carriage of `Trishul’ on the person of passenger should not be permitted. 
 
 
  
This issues with the approval of Commissioner of Security (Civil Aviation). 
 
 
(J.P. VERMA) 
OFFICER ON SPECIAL DUTY (INT) 
 
(REF: NO.CAS-43(19) / 96-DIV-II 
Dated : 22.06.1998)
